84  /**
85   * <p>The {@link CachingHttpClient} is meant to be a drop-in replacement for
86   * a {@link DefaultHttpClient} that transparently adds client-side caching.
87   * The current implementation is conditionally compliant with HTTP/1.1
88   * (meaning all the MUST and MUST NOTs are obeyed), although quite a lot,
89   * though not all, of the SHOULDs and SHOULD NOTs are obeyed too. Generally
90   * speaking, you construct a {@code CachingHttpClient} by providing a
91   * "backend" {@link HttpClient} used for making actual network requests and
92   * provide an {@link HttpCacheStorage} instance to use for holding onto
93   * cached responses. Additional configuration options can be provided by
94   * passing in a {@link CacheConfig}. Note that all of the usual client
95   * related configuration you want to do vis-a-vis timeouts and connection
96   * pools should be done on this backend client before constructing a {@code
97   * CachingHttpClient} from it.</p>
98   *
99   * <p>Generally speaking, the {@code CachingHttpClient} is implemented as a
100  * <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decorator_pattern">Decorator</a>
101  * of the backend client; for any incoming request it attempts to satisfy
102  * it from the cache, but if it can't, or if it needs to revalidate a stale
103  * cache entry, it will use the backend client to make an actual request.
104  * However, a proper HTTP/1.1 cache won't change the semantics of a request
105  * and response; in particular, if you issue an unconditional request you
106  * will get a full response (although it may be served to you from the cache,
107  * or the cache may make a conditional request on your behalf to the origin).
108  * This notion of "semantic transparency" means you should be able to drop
109  * a {@link CachingHttpClient} into an existing application without breaking
110  * anything.</p>
111  *
112  * <p>Folks that would like to experiment with alternative storage backends
113  * should look at the {@link HttpCacheStorage} interface and the related
114  * package documentation there. You may also be interested in the provided
115  * {@link org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.ehcache.EhcacheHttpCacheStorage
116  * EhCache} and {@link
117  * org.apache.http.impl.client.cache.memcached.MemcachedHttpCacheStorage
118  * memcached} storage backends.</p>
119  * </p>
120  * @since 4.1
121  *
122  * @deprecated (4.3) use {@link CachingHttpClientBuilder} or {@link CachingHttpClients}.
123  */
124 @Deprecated
125 @ThreadSafe // So long as the responseCache implementation is threadsafe
126 public class CachingHttpClient implements HttpClient {
127 
128     /**
129      * This is the name under which the {@link
130      * org.apache.http.client.cache.CacheResponseStatus} of a request
131      * (for example, whether it resulted in a cache hit) will be recorded if an
132      * {@link HttpContext} is provided during execution.
133      */
134     public static final String CACHE_RESPONSE_STATUS = "http.cache.response.status";
135 
136     private final static boolean SUPPORTS_RANGE_AND_CONTENT_RANGE_HEADERS = false;
137 
138     private final AtomicLong cacheHits = new AtomicLong();
139     private final AtomicLong cacheMisses = new AtomicLong();
140     private final AtomicLong cacheUpdates = new AtomicLong();
141 
142     private final Map<ProtocolVersion, String> viaHeaders = new HashMap<ProtocolVersion, String>(4);
143 
144     private final HttpClient backend;
145     private final HttpCache responseCache;
146     private final CacheValidityPolicy validityPolicy;
147     private final ResponseCachingPolicy responseCachingPolicy;
148     private final CachedHttpResponseGenerator responseGenerator;
149     private final CacheableRequestPolicy cacheableRequestPolicy;
150     private final CachedResponseSuitabilityChecker suitabilityChecker;
151 
152     private final ConditionalRequestBuilder conditionalRequestBuilder;
153 
154     private final long maxObjectSizeBytes;
155     private final boolean sharedCache;
156 
157     private final ResponseProtocolCompliance responseCompliance;
158     private final RequestProtocolCompliance requestCompliance;
159 
160     private final AsynchronousValidator asynchRevalidator;
161 
162     private final Log log = LogFactory.getLog(getClass());
163 
164     CachingHttpClient(
165             final HttpClient client,
166             final HttpCache cache,
167             final CacheConfig config) {
168         super();
169         Args.notNull(client, "HttpClient");
170         Args.notNull(cache, "HttpCache");
171         Args.notNull(config, "CacheConfig");
172         this.maxObjectSizeBytes = config.getMaxObjectSize();
173         this.sharedCache = config.isSharedCache();
174         this.backend = client;
175         this.responseCache = cache;
176         this.validityPolicy = new CacheValidityPolicy();
177         this.responseCachingPolicy = new ResponseCachingPolicy(maxObjectSizeBytes, sharedCache,
178                 config.isNeverCacheHTTP10ResponsesWithQuery(), config.is303CachingEnabled());
179         this.responseGenerator = new CachedHttpResponseGenerator(this.validityPolicy);
180         this.cacheableRequestPolicy = new CacheableRequestPolicy();
181         this.suitabilityChecker = new CachedResponseSuitabilityChecker(this.validityPolicy, config);
182         this.conditionalRequestBuilder = new ConditionalRequestBuilder();
183 
184         this.responseCompliance = new ResponseProtocolCompliance();
185         this.requestCompliance = new RequestProtocolCompliance(config.isWeakETagOnPutDeleteAllowed());
186 
187         this.asynchRevalidator = makeAsynchronousValidator(config);
188     }
189 
190     /**
191      * Constructs a {@code CachingHttpClient} with default caching settings that
192      * stores cache entries in memory and uses a vanilla {@link DefaultHttpClient}
193      * for backend requests.
194      */
195     public CachingHttpClient() {
196         this(new DefaultHttpClient(),
197                 new BasicHttpCache(),
198                 new CacheConfig());
199     }
200 
201     /**
202      * Constructs a {@code CachingHttpClient} with the given caching options that
203      * stores cache entries in memory and uses a vanilla {@link DefaultHttpClient}
204      * for backend requests.
205      * @param config cache module options
206      */
207     public CachingHttpClient(final CacheConfig config) {
208         this(new DefaultHttpClient(),
209                 new BasicHttpCache(config),
210                 config);
211     }
212 
213     /**
214      * Constructs a {@code CachingHttpClient} with default caching settings that
215      * stores cache entries in memory and uses the given {@link HttpClient}
216      * for backend requests.
217      * @param client used to make origin requests
218      */
219     public CachingHttpClient(final HttpClient client) {
220         this(client,
221                 new BasicHttpCache(),
222                 new CacheConfig());
223     }
224 
225     /**
226      * Constructs a {@code CachingHttpClient} with the given caching options that
227      * stores cache entries in memory and uses the given {@link HttpClient}
228      * for backend requests.
229      * @param config cache module options
230      * @param client used to make origin requests
231      */
232     public CachingHttpClient(final HttpClient client, final CacheConfig config) {
233         this(client,
234                 new BasicHttpCache(config),
235                 config);
236     }
237 
238     /**
239      * Constructs a {@code CachingHttpClient} with the given caching options
240      * that stores cache entries in the provided storage backend and uses
241      * the given {@link HttpClient} for backend requests. However, cached
242      * response bodies are managed using the given {@link ResourceFactory}.
243      * @param client used to make origin requests
244      * @param resourceFactory how to manage cached response bodies
245      * @param storage where to store cache entries
246      * @param config cache module options
247      */
248     public CachingHttpClient(
249             final HttpClient client,
250             final ResourceFactory resourceFactory,
251             final HttpCacheStorage storage,
252             final CacheConfig config) {
253         this(client,
254                 new BasicHttpCache(resourceFactory, storage, config),
255                 config);
256     }
257 
258     /**
259      * Constructs a {@code CachingHttpClient} with the given caching options
260      * that stores cache entries in the provided storage backend and uses
261      * the given {@link HttpClient} for backend requests.
262      * @param client used to make origin requests
263      * @param storage where to store cache entries
264      * @param config cache module options
265      */
266     public CachingHttpClient(
267             final HttpClient client,
268             final HttpCacheStorage storage,
269             final CacheConfig config) {
270         this(client,
271                 new BasicHttpCache(new HeapResourceFactory(), storage, config),
272                 config);
273     }
274 
275     CachingHttpClient(
276             final HttpClient backend,
277             final CacheValidityPolicy validityPolicy,
278             final ResponseCachingPolicy responseCachingPolicy,
279             final HttpCache responseCache,
280             final CachedHttpResponseGenerator responseGenerator,
281             final CacheableRequestPolicy cacheableRequestPolicy,
282             final CachedResponseSuitabilityChecker suitabilityChecker,
283             final ConditionalRequestBuilder conditionalRequestBuilder,
284             final ResponseProtocolCompliance responseCompliance,
285             final RequestProtocolCompliance requestCompliance) {
286         final CacheConfig config = new CacheConfig();
287         this.maxObjectSizeBytes = config.getMaxObjectSize();
288         this.sharedCache = config.isSharedCache();
289         this.backend = backend;
290         this.validityPolicy = validityPolicy;
291         this.responseCachingPolicy = responseCachingPolicy;
292         this.responseCache = responseCache;
293         this.responseGenerator = responseGenerator;
294         this.cacheableRequestPolicy = cacheableRequestPolicy;
295         this.suitabilityChecker = suitabilityChecker;
296         this.conditionalRequestBuilder = conditionalRequestBuilder;
297         this.responseCompliance = responseCompliance;
298         this.requestCompliance = requestCompliance;
299         this.asynchRevalidator = makeAsynchronousValidator(config);
300     }
301 
302     private AsynchronousValidator makeAsynchronousValidator(
303             final CacheConfig config) {
304         if (config.getAsynchronousWorkersMax() > 0) {
305             return new AsynchronousValidator(this, config);
306         }
307         return null;
308     }
309 
310     /**
311      * Reports the number of times that the cache successfully responded
312      * to an {@link HttpRequest} without contacting the origin server.
313      * @return the number of cache hits
314      */
315     public long getCacheHits() {
316         return cacheHits.get();
317     }
318 
319     /**
320      * Reports the number of times that the cache contacted the origin
321      * server because it had no appropriate response cached.
322      * @return the number of cache misses
323      */
324     public long getCacheMisses() {
325         return cacheMisses.get();
326     }
327 
328     /**
329      * Reports the number of times that the cache was able to satisfy
330      * a response by revalidating an existing but stale cache entry.
331      * @return the number of cache revalidations
332      */
333     public long getCacheUpdates() {
334         return cacheUpdates.get();
335     }
336 
337     public HttpResponse execute(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequest request) throws IOException {
338         final HttpContext defaultContext = null;
339         return execute(target, request, defaultContext);
340     }
341 
342     public <T> T execute(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequest request,
343                          final ResponseHandler<? extends T> responseHandler) throws IOException {
344         return execute(target, request, responseHandler, null);
345     }
346 
347     public <T> T execute(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequest request,
348                          final ResponseHandler<? extends T> responseHandler, final HttpContext context) throws IOException {
349         final HttpResponse resp = execute(target, request, context);
350         return handleAndConsume(responseHandler,resp);
351     }
352 
353     public HttpResponse execute(final HttpUriRequest request) throws IOException {
354         final HttpContext context = null;
355         return execute(request, context);
356     }
357 
358     public HttpResponse execute(final HttpUriRequest request, final HttpContext context) throws IOException {
359         final URI uri = request.getURI();
360         final HttpHost httpHost = new HttpHost(uri.getHost(), uri.getPort(), uri.getScheme());
361         return execute(httpHost, request, context);
362     }
363 
364     public <T> T execute(final HttpUriRequest request, final ResponseHandler<? extends T> responseHandler)
365             throws IOException {
366         return execute(request, responseHandler, null);
367     }
368 
369     public <T> T execute(final HttpUriRequest request, final ResponseHandler<? extends T> responseHandler,
370                          final HttpContext context) throws IOException {
371         final HttpResponse resp = execute(request, context);
372         return handleAndConsume(responseHandler, resp);
373     }
374 
375     private <T> T handleAndConsume(
376             final ResponseHandler<? extends T> responseHandler,
377             final HttpResponse response) throws Error, IOException {
378         T result;
379         try {
380             result = responseHandler.handleResponse(response);
381         } catch (final Exception t) {
382             final HttpEntity entity = response.getEntity();
383             try {
384                 EntityUtils.consume(entity);
385             } catch (final Exception t2) {
386                 // Log this exception. The original exception is more
387                 // important and will be thrown to the caller.
388                 this.log.warn("Error consuming content after an exception.", t2);
389             }
390             if (t instanceof RuntimeException) {
391                 throw (RuntimeException) t;
392             }
393             if (t instanceof IOException) {
394                 throw (IOException) t;
395             }
396             throw new UndeclaredThrowableException(t);
397         }
398 
399         // Handling the response was successful. Ensure that the content has
400         // been fully consumed.
401         final HttpEntity entity = response.getEntity();
402         EntityUtils.consume(entity);
403         return result;
404     }
405 
406     public ClientConnectionManager getConnectionManager() {
407         return backend.getConnectionManager();
408     }
409 
410     public HttpParams getParams() {
411         return backend.getParams();
412     }
413 
414     public HttpResponse execute(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequest originalRequest, final HttpContext context)
415             throws IOException {
416 
417         HttpRequestWrapper request;
418         if (originalRequest instanceof HttpRequestWrapper) {
419             request = ((HttpRequestWrapper) originalRequest);
420         } else {
421             request = HttpRequestWrapper.wrap(originalRequest);
422         }
423         final String via = generateViaHeader(originalRequest);
424 
425         // default response context
426         setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.CACHE_MISS);
427 
428         if (clientRequestsOurOptions(request)) {
429             setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.CACHE_MODULE_RESPONSE);
430             return new OptionsHttp11Response();
431         }
432 
433         final HttpResponse fatalErrorResponse = getFatallyNoncompliantResponse(
434                 request, context);
435         if (fatalErrorResponse != null) {
436             return fatalErrorResponse;
437         }
438 
439         requestCompliance.makeRequestCompliant(request);
440         request.addHeader("Via",via);
441 
442         flushEntriesInvalidatedByRequest(target, request);
443 
444         if (!cacheableRequestPolicy.isServableFromCache(request)) {
445             log.debug("Request is not servable from cache");
446             return callBackend(target, request, context);
447         }
448 
449         final HttpCacheEntry entry = satisfyFromCache(target, request);
450         if (entry == null) {
451             log.debug("Cache miss");
452             return handleCacheMiss(target, request, context);
453         }
454 
455         return handleCacheHit(target, request, context, entry);
456     }
457 
458     private HttpResponse handleCacheHit(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request,
459             final HttpContext context, final HttpCacheEntry entry)
460             throws ClientProtocolException, IOException {
461         recordCacheHit(target, request);
462         HttpResponse out = null;
463         final Date now = getCurrentDate();
464         if (suitabilityChecker.canCachedResponseBeUsed(target, request, entry, now)) {
465             log.debug("Cache hit");
466             out = generateCachedResponse(request, context, entry, now);
467         } else if (!mayCallBackend(request)) {
468             log.debug("Cache entry not suitable but only-if-cached requested");
469             out = generateGatewayTimeout(context);
470         } else {
471             log.debug("Revalidating cache entry");
472             return revalidateCacheEntry(target, request, context, entry, now);
473         }
474         if (context != null) {
475             context.setAttribute(ExecutionContext.HTTP_TARGET_HOST, target);
476             context.setAttribute(ExecutionContext.HTTP_REQUEST, request);
477             context.setAttribute(ExecutionContext.HTTP_RESPONSE, out);
478             context.setAttribute(ExecutionContext.HTTP_REQ_SENT, Boolean.TRUE);
479         }
480         return out;
481     }
482 
483     private HttpResponse revalidateCacheEntry(final HttpHost target,
484             final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpContext context, final HttpCacheEntry entry,
485             final Date now) throws ClientProtocolException {
486 
487         try {
488             if (asynchRevalidator != null
489                 && !staleResponseNotAllowed(request, entry, now)
490                 && validityPolicy.mayReturnStaleWhileRevalidating(entry, now)) {
491                 log.trace("Serving stale with asynchronous revalidation");
492                 final HttpResponse resp = generateCachedResponse(request, context, entry, now);
493 
494                 asynchRevalidator.revalidateCacheEntry(target, request, context, entry);
495 
496                 return resp;
497             }
498             return revalidateCacheEntry(target, request, context, entry);
499         } catch (final IOException ioex) {
500             return handleRevalidationFailure(request, context, entry, now);
501         } catch (final ProtocolException e) {
502             throw new ClientProtocolException(e);
503         }
504     }
505 
506     private HttpResponse handleCacheMiss(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request,
507             final HttpContext context) throws IOException {
508         recordCacheMiss(target, request);
509 
510         if (!mayCallBackend(request)) {
511             return new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT,
512                     "Gateway Timeout");
513         }
514 
515         final Map<String, Variant> variants =
516             getExistingCacheVariants(target, request);
517         if (variants != null && variants.size() > 0) {
518             return negotiateResponseFromVariants(target, request, context, variants);
519         }
520 
521         return callBackend(target, request, context);
522     }
523 
524     private HttpCacheEntry satisfyFromCache(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request) {
525         HttpCacheEntry entry = null;
526         try {
527             entry = responseCache.getCacheEntry(target, request);
528         } catch (final IOException ioe) {
529             log.warn("Unable to retrieve entries from cache", ioe);
530         }
531         return entry;
532     }
533 
534     private HttpResponse getFatallyNoncompliantResponse(final HttpRequestWrapper request,
535             final HttpContext context) {
536         HttpResponse fatalErrorResponse = null;
537         final List<RequestProtocolError> fatalError = requestCompliance.requestIsFatallyNonCompliant(request);
538 
539         for (final RequestProtocolError error : fatalError) {
540             setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.CACHE_MODULE_RESPONSE);
541             fatalErrorResponse = requestCompliance.getErrorForRequest(error);
542         }
543         return fatalErrorResponse;
544     }
545 
546     private Map<String, Variant> getExistingCacheVariants(final HttpHost target,
547             final HttpRequestWrapper request) {
548         Map<String,Variant> variants = null;
549         try {
550             variants = responseCache.getVariantCacheEntriesWithEtags(target, request);
551         } catch (final IOException ioe) {
552             log.warn("Unable to retrieve variant entries from cache", ioe);
553         }
554         return variants;
555     }
556 
557     private void recordCacheMiss(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request) {
558         cacheMisses.getAndIncrement();
559         if (log.isTraceEnabled()) {
560             final RequestLine rl = request.getRequestLine();
561             log.trace("Cache miss [host: " + target + "; uri: " + rl.getUri() + "]");
562         }
563     }
564 
565     private void recordCacheHit(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request) {
566         cacheHits.getAndIncrement();
567         if (log.isTraceEnabled()) {
568             final RequestLine rl = request.getRequestLine();
569             log.trace("Cache hit [host: " + target + "; uri: " + rl.getUri() + "]");
570         }
571     }
572 
573     private void recordCacheUpdate(final HttpContext context) {
574         cacheUpdates.getAndIncrement();
575         setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.VALIDATED);
576     }
577 
578     private void flushEntriesInvalidatedByRequest(final HttpHost target,
579             final HttpRequestWrapper request) {
580         try {
581             responseCache.flushInvalidatedCacheEntriesFor(target, request);
582         } catch (final IOException ioe) {
583             log.warn("Unable to flush invalidated entries from cache", ioe);
584         }
585     }
586 
587     private HttpResponse generateCachedResponse(final HttpRequestWrapper request,
588             final HttpContext context, final HttpCacheEntry entry, final Date now) {
589         final HttpResponse cachedResponse;
590         if (request.containsHeader(HeaderConstants.IF_NONE_MATCH)
591                 || request.containsHeader(HeaderConstants.IF_MODIFIED_SINCE)) {
592             cachedResponse = responseGenerator.generateNotModifiedResponse(entry);
593         } else {
594             cachedResponse = responseGenerator.generateResponse(entry);
595         }
596         setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.CACHE_HIT);
597         if (validityPolicy.getStalenessSecs(entry, now) > 0L) {
598             cachedResponse.addHeader(HeaderConstants.WARNING,"110 localhost \"Response is stale\"");
599         }
600         return cachedResponse;
601     }
602 
603     private HttpResponse handleRevalidationFailure(final HttpRequestWrapper request,
604             final HttpContext context, final HttpCacheEntry entry, final Date now) {
605         if (staleResponseNotAllowed(request, entry, now)) {
606             return generateGatewayTimeout(context);
607         } else {
608             return unvalidatedCacheHit(context, entry);
609         }
610     }
611 
612     private HttpResponse generateGatewayTimeout(final HttpContext context) {
613         setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.CACHE_MODULE_RESPONSE);
614         return new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1,
615                 HttpStatus.SC_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT, "Gateway Timeout");
616     }
617 
618     private HttpResponse unvalidatedCacheHit(final HttpContext context,
619             final HttpCacheEntry entry) {
620         final HttpResponse cachedResponse = responseGenerator.generateResponse(entry);
621         setResponseStatus(context, CacheResponseStatus.CACHE_HIT);
622         cachedResponse.addHeader(HeaderConstants.WARNING, "111 localhost \"Revalidation failed\"");
623         return cachedResponse;
624     }
625 
626     private boolean staleResponseNotAllowed(final HttpRequestWrapper request,
627             final HttpCacheEntry entry, final Date now) {
628         return validityPolicy.mustRevalidate(entry)
629             || (isSharedCache() && validityPolicy.proxyRevalidate(entry))
630             || explicitFreshnessRequest(request, entry, now);
631     }
632 
633     private boolean mayCallBackend(final HttpRequestWrapper request) {
634         for (final Header h: request.getHeaders(HeaderConstants.CACHE_CONTROL)) {
635             for (final HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
636                 if ("only-if-cached".equals(elt.getName())) {
637                     log.trace("Request marked only-if-cached");
638                     return false;
639                 }
640             }
641         }
642         return true;
643     }
644 
645     private boolean explicitFreshnessRequest(final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpCacheEntry entry, final Date now) {
646         for(final Header h : request.getHeaders(HeaderConstants.CACHE_CONTROL)) {
647             for(final HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
648                 if (HeaderConstants.CACHE_CONTROL_MAX_STALE.equals(elt.getName())) {
649                     try {
650                         final int maxstale = Integer.parseInt(elt.getValue());
651                         final long age = validityPolicy.getCurrentAgeSecs(entry, now);
652                         final long lifetime = validityPolicy.getFreshnessLifetimeSecs(entry);
653                         if (age - lifetime > maxstale) {
654                             return true;
655                         }
656                     } catch (final NumberFormatException nfe) {
657                         return true;
658                     }
659                 } else if (HeaderConstants.CACHE_CONTROL_MIN_FRESH.equals(elt.getName())
660                             || HeaderConstants.CACHE_CONTROL_MAX_AGE.equals(elt.getName())) {
661                     return true;
662                 }
663             }
664         }
665         return false;
666     }
667 
668     private String generateViaHeader(final HttpMessage msg) {
669 
670         final ProtocolVersion pv = msg.getProtocolVersion();
671         final String existingEntry = viaHeaders.get(pv);
672         if (existingEntry != null) {
673             return existingEntry;
674         }
675 
676         final VersionInfo vi = VersionInfo.loadVersionInfo("org.apache.http.client", getClass().getClassLoader());
677         final String release = (vi != null) ? vi.getRelease() : VersionInfo.UNAVAILABLE;
678 
679         String value;
680         if ("http".equalsIgnoreCase(pv.getProtocol())) {
681             value = String.format("%d.%d localhost (Apache-HttpClient/%s (cache))", pv.getMajor(), pv.getMinor(),
682                     release);
683         } else {
684             value = String.format("%s/%d.%d localhost (Apache-HttpClient/%s (cache))", pv.getProtocol(), pv.getMajor(),
685                     pv.getMinor(), release);
686         }
687         viaHeaders.put(pv, value);
688 
689         return value;
690     }
691 
692     private void setResponseStatus(final HttpContext context, final CacheResponseStatus value) {
693         if (context != null) {
694             context.setAttribute(CACHE_RESPONSE_STATUS, value);
695         }
696     }
697 
698     /**
699      * Reports whether this {@code CachingHttpClient} implementation
700      * supports byte-range requests as specified by the {@code Range}
701      * and {@code Content-Range} headers.
702      * @return {@code true} if byte-range requests are supported
703      */
704     public boolean supportsRangeAndContentRangeHeaders() {
705         return SUPPORTS_RANGE_AND_CONTENT_RANGE_HEADERS;
706     }
707 
708     /**
709      * Reports whether this {@code CachingHttpClient} is configured as
710      * a shared (public) or non-shared (private) cache. See {@link
711      * CacheConfig#setSharedCache(boolean)}.
712      * @return {@code true} if we are behaving as a shared (public)
713      *   cache
714      */
715     public boolean isSharedCache() {
716         return sharedCache;
717     }
718 
719     Date getCurrentDate() {
720         return new Date();
721     }
722 
723     boolean clientRequestsOurOptions(final HttpRequest request) {
724         final RequestLine line = request.getRequestLine();
725 
726         if (!HeaderConstants.OPTIONS_METHOD.equals(line.getMethod())) {
727             return false;
728         }
729 
730         if (!"*".equals(line.getUri())) {
731             return false;
732         }
733 
734         if (!"0".equals(request.getFirstHeader(HeaderConstants.MAX_FORWARDS).getValue())) {
735             return false;
736         }
737 
738         return true;
739     }
740 
741     HttpResponse callBackend(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpContext context)
742             throws IOException {
743 
744         final Date requestDate = getCurrentDate();
745 
746         log.trace("Calling the backend");
747         final HttpResponse backendResponse = backend.execute(target, request, context);
748         backendResponse.addHeader("Via", generateViaHeader(backendResponse));
749         return handleBackendResponse(target, request, requestDate, getCurrentDate(),
750                 backendResponse);
751 
752     }
753 
754     private boolean revalidationResponseIsTooOld(final HttpResponse backendResponse,
755             final HttpCacheEntry cacheEntry) {
756         final Header entryDateHeader = cacheEntry.getFirstHeader(HTTP.DATE_HEADER);
757         final Header responseDateHeader = backendResponse.getFirstHeader(HTTP.DATE_HEADER);
758         if (entryDateHeader != null && responseDateHeader != null) {
759             try {
760                 final Date entryDate = DateUtils.parseDate(entryDateHeader.getValue());
761                 final Date respDate = DateUtils.parseDate(responseDateHeader.getValue());
762                 if (respDate.before(entryDate)) {
763                     return true;
764                 }
765             } catch (final DateParseException e) {
766                 // either backend response or cached entry did not have a valid
767                 // Date header, so we can't tell if they are out of order
768                 // according to the origin clock; thus we can skip the
769                 // unconditional retry recommended in 13.2.6 of RFC 2616.
770             }
771         }
772         return false;
773     }
774 
775     HttpResponse negotiateResponseFromVariants(final HttpHost target,
776             final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpContext context,
777             final Map<String, Variant> variants) throws IOException {
778         final HttpRequestWrapper conditionalRequest = conditionalRequestBuilder
779             .buildConditionalRequestFromVariants(request, variants);
780 
781         final Date requestDate = getCurrentDate();
782         final HttpResponse backendResponse = backend.execute(target, conditionalRequest, context);
783         final Date responseDate = getCurrentDate();
784 
785         backendResponse.addHeader("Via", generateViaHeader(backendResponse));
786 
787         if (backendResponse.getStatusLine().getStatusCode() != HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED) {
788             return handleBackendResponse(target, request, requestDate, responseDate, backendResponse);
789         }
790 
791         final Header resultEtagHeader = backendResponse.getFirstHeader(HeaderConstants.ETAG);
792         if (resultEtagHeader == null) {
793             log.warn("304 response did not contain ETag");
794             return callBackend(target, request, context);
795         }
796 
797         final String resultEtag = resultEtagHeader.getValue();
798         final Variant matchingVariant = variants.get(resultEtag);
799         if (matchingVariant == null) {
800             log.debug("304 response did not contain ETag matching one sent in If-None-Match");
801             return callBackend(target, request, context);
802         }
803 
804         final HttpCacheEntry matchedEntry = matchingVariant.getEntry();
805 
806         if (revalidationResponseIsTooOld(backendResponse, matchedEntry)) {
807             EntityUtils.consume(backendResponse.getEntity());
808             return retryRequestUnconditionally(target, request, context,
809                     matchedEntry);
810         }
811 
812         recordCacheUpdate(context);
813 
814         final HttpCacheEntry responseEntry = getUpdatedVariantEntry(target,
815                 conditionalRequest, requestDate, responseDate, backendResponse,
816                 matchingVariant, matchedEntry);
817 
818         final HttpResponse resp = responseGenerator.generateResponse(responseEntry);
819         tryToUpdateVariantMap(target, request, matchingVariant);
820 
821         if (shouldSendNotModifiedResponse(request, responseEntry)) {
822             return responseGenerator.generateNotModifiedResponse(responseEntry);
823         }
824 
825         return resp;
826     }
827 
828     private HttpResponse retryRequestUnconditionally(final HttpHost target,
829             final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpContext context,
830             final HttpCacheEntry matchedEntry) throws IOException {
831         final HttpRequestWrapper unconditional = conditionalRequestBuilder
832             .buildUnconditionalRequest(request, matchedEntry);
833         return callBackend(target, unconditional, context);
834     }
835 
836     private HttpCacheEntry getUpdatedVariantEntry(final HttpHost target,
837             final HttpRequestWrapper conditionalRequest, final Date requestDate,
838             final Date responseDate, final HttpResponse backendResponse,
839             final Variant matchingVariant, final HttpCacheEntry matchedEntry) {
840         HttpCacheEntry responseEntry = matchedEntry;
841         try {
842             responseEntry = responseCache.updateVariantCacheEntry(target, conditionalRequest,
843                     matchedEntry, backendResponse, requestDate, responseDate, matchingVariant.getCacheKey());
844         } catch (final IOException ioe) {
845             log.warn("Could not update cache entry", ioe);
846         }
847         return responseEntry;
848     }
849 
850     private void tryToUpdateVariantMap(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequestWrapper request,
851             final Variant matchingVariant) {
852         try {
853             responseCache.reuseVariantEntryFor(target, request, matchingVariant);
854         } catch (final IOException ioe) {
855             log.warn("Could not update cache entry to reuse variant", ioe);
856         }
857     }
858 
859     private boolean shouldSendNotModifiedResponse(final HttpRequestWrapper request,
860             final HttpCacheEntry responseEntry) {
861         return (suitabilityChecker.isConditional(request)
862                 && suitabilityChecker.allConditionalsMatch(request, responseEntry, new Date()));
863     }
864 
865     HttpResponse revalidateCacheEntry(
866             final HttpHost target,
867             final HttpRequestWrapper request,
868             final HttpContext context,
869             final HttpCacheEntry cacheEntry) throws IOException, ProtocolException {
870 
871         final HttpRequestWrapper conditionalRequest = conditionalRequestBuilder.buildConditionalRequest(request, cacheEntry);
872 
873         Date requestDate = getCurrentDate();
874         HttpResponse backendResponse = backend.execute(target, conditionalRequest, context);
875         Date responseDate = getCurrentDate();
876 
877         if (revalidationResponseIsTooOld(backendResponse, cacheEntry)) {
878             EntityUtils.consume(backendResponse.getEntity());
879             final HttpRequest unconditional = conditionalRequestBuilder
880                 .buildUnconditionalRequest(request, cacheEntry);
881             requestDate = getCurrentDate();
882             backendResponse = backend.execute(target, unconditional, context);
883             responseDate = getCurrentDate();
884         }
885 
886         backendResponse.addHeader(HeaderConstants.VIA, generateViaHeader(backendResponse));
887 
888         final int statusCode = backendResponse.getStatusLine().getStatusCode();
889         if (statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED || statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_OK) {
890             recordCacheUpdate(context);
891         }
892 
893         if (statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED) {
894             final HttpCacheEntry updatedEntry = responseCache.updateCacheEntry(target, request, cacheEntry,
895                     backendResponse, requestDate, responseDate);
896             if (suitabilityChecker.isConditional(request)
897                     && suitabilityChecker.allConditionalsMatch(request, updatedEntry, new Date())) {
898                 return responseGenerator.generateNotModifiedResponse(updatedEntry);
899             }
900             return responseGenerator.generateResponse(updatedEntry);
901         }
902 
903         if (staleIfErrorAppliesTo(statusCode)
904             && !staleResponseNotAllowed(request, cacheEntry, getCurrentDate())
905             && validityPolicy.mayReturnStaleIfError(request, cacheEntry, responseDate)) {
906             final HttpResponse cachedResponse = responseGenerator.generateResponse(cacheEntry);
907             cachedResponse.addHeader(HeaderConstants.WARNING, "110 localhost \"Response is stale\"");
908             final HttpEntity errorBody = backendResponse.getEntity();
909             if (errorBody != null) {
910                 EntityUtils.consume(errorBody);
911             }
912             return cachedResponse;
913         }
914 
915         return handleBackendResponse(target, conditionalRequest, requestDate, responseDate,
916                                      backendResponse);
917     }
918 
919     private boolean staleIfErrorAppliesTo(final int statusCode) {
920         return statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
921                 || statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_BAD_GATEWAY
922                 || statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
923                 || statusCode == HttpStatus.SC_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT;
924     }
925 
926     HttpResponse handleBackendResponse(
927             final HttpHost target,
928             final HttpRequestWrapper request,
929             final Date requestDate,
930             final Date responseDate,
931             final HttpResponse backendResponse) throws IOException {
932 
933         log.trace("Handling Backend response");
934         responseCompliance.ensureProtocolCompliance(request, backendResponse);
935 
936         final boolean cacheable = responseCachingPolicy.isResponseCacheable(request, backendResponse);
937         responseCache.flushInvalidatedCacheEntriesFor(target, request, backendResponse);
938         if (cacheable &&
939             !alreadyHaveNewerCacheEntry(target, request, backendResponse)) {
940             try {
941                 storeRequestIfModifiedSinceFor304Response(request, backendResponse);
942                 return responseCache.cacheAndReturnResponse(target, request, backendResponse, requestDate,
943                         responseDate);
944             } catch (final IOException ioe) {
945                 log.warn("Unable to store entries in cache", ioe);
946             }
947         }
948         if (!cacheable) {
949             try {
950                 responseCache.flushCacheEntriesFor(target, request);
951             } catch (final IOException ioe) {
952                 log.warn("Unable to flush invalid cache entries", ioe);
953             }
954         }
955         return backendResponse;
956     }
957 
958     /**
959      * For 304 Not modified responses, adds a "Last-Modified" header with the
960      * value of the "If-Modified-Since" header passed in the request. This
961      * header is required to be able to reuse match the cache entry for
962      * subsequent requests but as defined in http specifications it is not
963      * included in 304 responses by backend servers. This header will not be
964      * included in the resulting response.
965      */
966     private void storeRequestIfModifiedSinceFor304Response(
967             final HttpRequest request, final HttpResponse backendResponse) {
968         if (backendResponse.getStatusLine().getStatusCode() == HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED) {
969             final Header h = request.getFirstHeader("If-Modified-Since");
970             if (h != null) {
971                 backendResponse.addHeader("Last-Modified", h.getValue());
972             }
973         }
974     }
975 
976     private boolean alreadyHaveNewerCacheEntry(final HttpHost target, final HttpRequest request,
977             final HttpResponse backendResponse) {
978         HttpCacheEntry existing = null;
979         try {
980             existing = responseCache.getCacheEntry(target, request);
981         } catch (final IOException ioe) {
982             // nop
983         }
984         if (existing == null) {
985             return false;
986         }
987         final Header entryDateHeader = existing.getFirstHeader(HTTP.DATE_HEADER);
988         if (entryDateHeader == null) {
989             return false;
990         }
991         final Header responseDateHeader = backendResponse.getFirstHeader(HTTP.DATE_HEADER);
992         if (responseDateHeader == null) {
993             return false;
994         }
995         try {
996             final Date entryDate = DateUtils.parseDate(entryDateHeader.getValue());
997             final Date responseDate = DateUtils.parseDate(responseDateHeader.getValue());
998             return responseDate.before(entryDate);
999         } catch (final DateParseException e) {
1000             // Empty on Purpose
1001         }
1002         return false;
1003     }
1004 
1005     static class AsynchronousValidator {
1006         private final CachingHttpClient cachingClient;
1007         private final ExecutorService executor;
1008         private final Set<String> queued;
1009         private final CacheKeyGenerator cacheKeyGenerator;
1010 
1011         private final Log log = LogFactory.getLog(getClass());
1012 
1013         /**
1014          * Create AsynchronousValidator which will make revalidation requests
1015          * using the supplied {@link CachingHttpClient}, and
1016          * a {@link ThreadPoolExecutor} generated according to the thread
1017          * pool settings provided in the given {@link CacheConfig}.
1018          * @param cachingClient used to execute asynchronous requests
1019          * @param config specifies thread pool settings. See
1020          * {@link CacheConfig#getAsynchronousWorkersMax()},
1021          * {@link CacheConfig#getAsynchronousWorkersCore()},
1022          * {@link CacheConfig#getAsynchronousWorkerIdleLifetimeSecs()},
1023          * and {@link CacheConfig#getRevalidationQueueSize()}.
1024          */
1025         public AsynchronousValidator(final CachingHttpClient cachingClient,
1026                 final CacheConfig config) {
1027             this(cachingClient,
1028                     new ThreadPoolExecutor(config.getAsynchronousWorkersCore(),
1029                             config.getAsynchronousWorkersMax(),
1030                             config.getAsynchronousWorkerIdleLifetimeSecs(),
1031                             TimeUnit.SECONDS,
1032                             new ArrayBlockingQueue<Runnable>(config.getRevalidationQueueSize()))
1033                     );
1034         }
1035 
1036         /**
1037          * Create AsynchronousValidator which will make revalidation requests
1038          * using the supplied {@link CachingHttpClient} and
1039          * {@link ExecutorService}.
1040          * @param cachingClient used to execute asynchronous requests
1041          * @param executor used to manage a thread pool of revalidation workers
1042          */
1043         AsynchronousValidator(final CachingHttpClient cachingClient,
1044                 final ExecutorService executor) {
1045             this.cachingClient = cachingClient;
1046             this.executor = executor;
1047             this.queued = new HashSet<String>();
1048             this.cacheKeyGenerator = new CacheKeyGenerator();
1049         }
1050 
1051         /**
1052          * Schedules an asynchronous revalidation
1053          *
1054          * @param target
1055          * @param request
1056          * @param context
1057          * @param entry
1058          */
1059         public synchronized void revalidateCacheEntry(final HttpHost target,
1060                 final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpContext context, final HttpCacheEntry entry) {
1061             // getVariantURI will fall back on getURI if no variants exist
1062             final String uri = cacheKeyGenerator.getVariantURI(target, request, entry);
1063 
1064             if (!queued.contains(uri)) {
1065                 final AsynchronousValidationRequest revalidationRequest =
1066                     new AsynchronousValidationRequest(this, cachingClient, target,
1067                             request, context, entry, uri);
1068 
1069                 try {
1070                     executor.execute(revalidationRequest);
1071                     queued.add(uri);
1072                 } catch (final RejectedExecutionException ree) {
1073                     log.debug("Revalidation for [" + uri + "] not scheduled: " + ree);
1074                 }
1075             }
1076         }
1077 
1078         /**
1079          * Removes an identifier from the internal list of revalidation jobs in
1080          * progress.  This is meant to be called by
1081          * {@link AsynchronousValidationRequest#run()} once the revalidation is
1082          * complete, using the identifier passed in during constructions.
1083          * @param identifier
1084          */
1085         synchronized void markComplete(final String identifier) {
1086             queued.remove(identifier);
1087         }
1088 
1089         Set<String> getScheduledIdentifiers() {
1090             return Collections.unmodifiableSet(queued);
1091         }
1092 
1093         ExecutorService getExecutor() {
1094             return executor;
1095         }
1096     }
1097 
1098     static class AsynchronousValidationRequest implements Runnable {
1099         private final AsynchronousValidator parent;
1100         private final CachingHttpClient cachingClient;
1101         private final HttpHost target;
1102         private final HttpRequestWrapper request;
1103         private final HttpContext context;
1104         private final HttpCacheEntry cacheEntry;
1105         private final String identifier;
1106 
1107         private final Log log = LogFactory.getLog(getClass());
1108 
1109         /**
1110          * Used internally by {@link AsynchronousValidator} to schedule a
1111          * revalidation.
1112          * @param cachingClient
1113          * @param target
1114          * @param request
1115          * @param context
1116          * @param cacheEntry
1117          * @param bookKeeping
1118          * @param identifier
1119          */
1120         AsynchronousValidationRequest(final AsynchronousValidator parent,
1121                 final CachingHttpClient cachingClient, final HttpHost target,
1122                 final HttpRequestWrapper request, final HttpContext context,
1123                 final HttpCacheEntry cacheEntry,
1124                 final String identifier) {
1125             this.parent = parent;
1126             this.cachingClient = cachingClient;
1127             this.target = target;
1128             this.request = request;
1129             this.context = context;
1130             this.cacheEntry = cacheEntry;
1131             this.identifier = identifier;
1132         }
1133 
1134         public void run() {
1135             try {
1136                 cachingClient.revalidateCacheEntry(target, request, context, cacheEntry);
1137             } catch (final IOException ioe) {
1138                 log.debug("Asynchronous revalidation failed due to exception: " + ioe);
1139             } catch (final ProtocolException pe) {
1140                 log.error("ProtocolException thrown during asynchronous revalidation: " + pe);
1141             } finally {
1142                 parent.markComplete(identifier);
1143             }
1144         }
1145 
1146         String getIdentifier() {
1147             return identifier;
1148         }
1149 
1150     }
1151
